testcase.name: runScenario["TC_UI_SAL_12 - Verify sorting by Quantity column", "Sales List Quantity Sorting Functionality"](1)
testcase.system-out: @ui @user @sales @sorting @TC_UI_SAL_12 @smoke @regression Scenario: TC_UI_SAL_12 - Verify sorting by Quantity column # src/test/resources/features/ui/sales/sales_list_quantity_sorting.feature:5 === Starting UI Test: TC_UI_SAL_12 - Verify sorting by Quantity column === Using admin credentials for login: admin Login completed successfully Given user is logged into the application # com.example.ui.stepDefinitions.sales.SalesListSteps.userIsLoggedIntoTheApplication() Navigation to sales list completed After navigation, current URL: http://localhost:8081/ui/sales And user navigates to Sales List page # com.example.ui.stepDefinitions.sales.SalesListSteps.salesRecordsAreDisplayedForPlants() And Quantity column header is visible and clickable # com.example.ui.stepDefinitions.sales.SalesListSteps.quantityColumnHeaderIsVisibleAndClickable() And verify initial quantities are displayed # com.example.ui.stepDefinitions.sales.SalesListSteps.verifyInitialQuantitiesAreDisplayed() And expected descending order should be 5, 3, 2 # com.example.ui.stepDefinitions.sales.SalesListSteps.expectedQuantitiesDescendingOrderShouldBe(int,int,int) When user clicks Quantity column header once # com.example.ui.stepDefinitions.sales.SalesListSteps.userClicksQuantityColumnHeaderOnce() Then quantities should be sorted in ascending order # com.example.ui.stepDefinitions.sales.SalesListSteps.quantitiesShouldBeSortedInAscendingOrder() And expected ascending order should be 2, 3, 5 # com.example.ui.stepDefinitions.sales.SalesListSteps.expectedQuantitiesAscendingOrderShouldBe(int,int,int) When user clicks Quantity column header again # com.example.ui.stepDefinitions.sales.SalesListSteps.userClicksQuantityColumnHeaderAgain() Then quantities should be sorted in descending order # com.example.ui.stepDefinitions.sales.SalesListSteps.quantitiesShouldBeSortedInDescendingOrder() And expected descending order should be 5, 3, 2 # com.example.ui.stepDefinitions.sales.SalesListSteps.expectedQuantitiesDescendingOrderShouldBe(int,int,int) When user clicks Quantity column header once # com.example.ui.stepDefinitions.sales.SalesListSteps.userClicksQuantityColumnHeaderOnce() Then quantities should be sorted in ascending order # com.example.ui.stepDefinitions.sales.SalesListSteps.quantitiesShouldBeSortedInAscendingOrder() And expected ascending order should be 2, 3, 5 # com.example.ui.stepDefinitions.sales.SalesListSteps.expectedQuantitiesAscendingOrderShouldBe(int,int,int) When user clicks Quantity column header once # com.example.ui.stepDefinitions.sales.SalesListSteps.userClicksQuantityColumnHeaderOnce() Then quantities should be sorted in descending order # com.example.ui.stepDefinitions.sales.SalesListSteps.quantitiesShouldBeSortedInDescendingOrder() And expected descending order should be 5, 3, 2 # com.example.ui.stepDefinitions.sales.SalesListSteps.expectedQuantitiesDescendingOrderShouldBe(int,int,int) When user clicks Quantity column header again # com.example.ui.stepDefinitions.sales.SalesListSteps.userClicksQuantityColumnHeaderAgain() Then quantities should be sorted in ascending order # com.example.ui.stepDefinitions.sales.SalesListSteps.quantitiesShouldBeSortedInAscendingOrder() And expected ascending order should be 2, 3, 5 # com.example.ui.stepDefinitions.sales.SalesListSteps.expectedQuantitiesAscendingOrderShouldBe(int,int,int) === Finished UI Test: TC_UI_SAL_12 - Verify sorting by Quantity column ===

com.example.ui.stepDefinitions.sales.SalesListSteps.userIsLoggedIntoTheApplication() Navigation to sales list completed After navigation, current URL: http://localhost:8081/ui/sales And user navigates to Sales List page # com.example.ui.stepDefinitions.sales.SalesListSteps.userNavigatesToSalesListPage() Current URL when checking Sales List page: http://localhost:8081/ui/sales And user is on Sales List page # com.example.ui.stepDefinitions.sales.SalesListSteps.userIsOnSalesListPage() And sales records are displayed for plants # com.example.ui.stepDefinitions.sales.SalesListSteps.salesRecordsAreDisplayedForPlants() And Total Price column header is visible and clickable # com.example.ui.stepDefinitions.sales.SalesListSteps.totalPriceColumnHeaderIsVisibleAndClickable() Actual total prices found: [10.0, 90.0, 28.0, 21.0] Has different prices for sorting: true And verify initial total prices are displayed # com.example.ui.stepDefinitions.sales.SalesListSteps.verifyInitialTotalPricesAreDisplayed() When user clicks Total Price column header once # com.example.ui.stepDefinitions.sales.SalesListSteps.userClicksTotalPriceColumnHeaderOnce() Then total prices should be sorted in ascending order # com.example.ui.stepDefinitions.sales.SalesListSteps.totalPricesShouldBeSortedInAscendingOrder() Actual prices in ascending order: [10.0, 21.0, 28.0, 90.0] And expected ascending order should be "$9.99", "$24.50", "$49.99", "$120.00" # com.example.ui.stepDefinitions.sales.SalesListSteps.expectedTotalPriceAscendingOrderShouldBe(java.lang.String,java.lang.String,java.lang.String,java.lang.String) When user clicks Total Price column header again # com.example.ui.stepDefinitions.sales.SalesListSteps.expectedTotalPriceDescendingOrderShouldBe(java.lang.String,java.lang.String,java.lang.String,java.lang.String) === Finished UI Test: TC_UI_SAL_13 - Verify sorting by Total Price column ===
